item.title: Download
item.description: The current stable version of Dunst is 1.3.1 released on Jan 30 2018. Downloads Source tarball Code repository (Github) Release Notes Version 1.3.1 addresses a race condition that can cause the service file to be empty upon installation. It contains no other changes, refer to the release notes for 1.3 bellow for more info on 1.3. Version 1.3 is supposed to be fully backwards compatible with 1.2.

item.title: Changelog
item.description: 1.3.1 - 2018-01-30 Fixed Race condition resulting in the service files being empty (#488) 1.3.0 - 2018-01-05 Added ellipsize option to control how long lines should be ellipsized when word_wrap is set to false (#374) A beginning tilde of a path is now expanded to the home of the current user (#351) The image-path hint is now respected, as GApplications send their icon only via this link (#447) The (legacy) image_data hint is now respected (#353) If dunst can’t acquire the DBus name, dunst prints the PID of the process holding the name (#458 #460) Increased accuracy of timeouts by using microseconds internally (#379 #291) Support for specifying timeout values in milliseconds, minutes, hours, or days.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Common problems Cannot open display Dunst was unable to connect to the X server. Make sure that X is running and that the DISPLAY environment variable is correctly set. If you’re using the systemd service, that might mean that dbus isn’t setting the right variables, see issue #347 for more details. Cannot connect to DBus Dunst cannot connect to your session bus at all. The session bus might not even exist.
